program main
    implicit none
    integer(8) :: a(4), product1, product2, product3, product4, max_val
    integer(8) :: temp, new_number
    integer :: transformed_digits(20), count, i, digit, transformed_digit
    logical :: first_digit

    !
children.label: code_analysis

children.text:
Read the four numbers
    read(*,*) a(1), a(2), a(3), a(4)

    ! Compute the products
    product1 = a(1)*a(3)
    product2 = a(2)*a(4)
    product3 = a(1)*a(4)
    product4 = a(2)*a(3)
    max_val = max(product1, product2, product3, product4)

    ! Process the max_val through the second program's logic
    temp = max_val
    count =0

    do while (temp >0)
        digit = mod(temp,10)
        if (9 - digit < digit) then
            if (temp/10 ==0 .and. (9 - digit ==0)) then
                transformed_digit = digit
            else
                transformed_digit = 9 - digit
            end if
        else
            transformed_digit = digit
        end if
        count = count +1
        transformed_digits(count) = transformed_digit
        temp = temp /10
    end do

    ! Reverse the array to get the correct order
    do i=1, count/2
        integer :: j = count -i +1
        integer :: temp_digit = transformed_digits(i)
        transformed_digits(i) = transformed_digits(j)
        transformed_digits(j) = temp_digit
    end do

    ! Build the new number
    new_number =0
    do i=1, count
        new_number = new_number *10 + transformed_digits(i)
    end do

    !

program main
    implicit none
    integer(8) :: a(4), product1, product2, product3, product4, max_val
    integer(8) :: temp, new_number
    integer :: transformed_digits(20), count, i, digit, transformed_digit, j, temp_digit

    read(*,*) a(1), a(2), a(3), a(4)

    product1 = a(1)*a(3)
    product2 = a(2)*a(4)
    product3 = a(1)*a(4)
    product4 = a(2)*a(3)
    max_val = max(product1, product2, product3, product4)

    temp = max_val
    count =0

    do while (temp >0)
        digit = mod(temp,10)
        if (9 - digit < digit) then
            if (temp/10 ==0 .and. (9 - digit ==0)) then
                transformed_digit = digit
            else
                transformed_digit = 9 - digit
            end if
        else
            transformed_digit = digit
        end if
        count = count +1
        transformed_digits(count) = transformed_digit
        temp = temp /10
    end do

    ! Reverse the array
    do i=1, count/2
        j = count -i +1
        temp_digit = transformed_digits(i)
        transformed_digits(i) = transformed_digits(j)
        transformed_digits(j) = temp_digit
    end do

    new_number =0
    do i=1, count
        new_number = new_number *10 + transformed_digits(i)

program main
    implicit none
    integer(8) :: a(4), product1, product2, product3, product4, max_val
    integer(8) :: temp, new_number
    integer :: transformed_digits(20), count, i, digit, transformed_digit
    logical :: first_digit

    ! Read the four numbers
    read(*,*) a(1), a(2), a(3), a(4)

    ! Compute the products
    product1 = a(1)*a(3)
    product2 = a(2)*a(4)
    product3 = a(1)*a(4)
    product4 = a(2)*a(3)

        if (9 - digit < digit) then
            if (temp/10 ==0 .and. (9 - digit ==0)) then
                transformed_digit = digit
            else
                transformed_digit = 9 - digit
            end if
        else
            transformed_digit = digit
        end if
        count = count +1
        transformed_digits(count) = transformed_digit
        temp = temp /10
    end do

    ! Reverse the array to get the correct order
    do i=1, count/2
        integer :: j = count -i +1
        integer :: temp_digit = transformed_digits(i)
        transformed_digits(i) = transformed_digits(j)

    end do

    ! Build the new number
    new_number =0
    do i=1, count
        new_number = new_number *10 + transformed_digits(i)
    end do

    ! Output the result
    print *, new_number

end program main
